summary: This is an email chain between attorney Sarah Coyne and federal prosecutors regarding a planned motion for sentence reduction for an unnamed client. The client attempted to cooperate with the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. The prosecutors acknowledge the client reached out unsolicited but clarify they did not rely on the information provided in investigating or charging the case.

persons.name: Sarah Coyne
persons.context: Attorney representing an unnamed client, communicating with federal prosecutors about filing a motion for sentence reduction based on the client's attempted cooperation in the Epstein death investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a death investigation by the SDNY that the unnamed client attempted to cooperate with.

connections.description: Sarah Coyne is preparing and filing a motion for sentence reduction on behalf of her client.
The client attempted to cooperate with the SDNY investigation into the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Attorney initiates motion discussion
events.description: Sarah Coyne emails prosecutors about her intent to file a motion for her client's sentence reduction, citing the client's attempted cooperation in the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Prosecutors respond to cooperation claim
events.description: Federal prosecutors respond, acknowledging the client reached out unsolicited but clarifying they did not rely on the information in investigating or charging the case.

keyFacts: An unnamed individual, represented by attorney Sarah Coyne, attempted to cooperate with the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Sarah Coyne was preparing a motion for a sentence reduction for her client based on this attempted cooperation.
Federal prosecutors acknowledged the client reached out unsolicited but explicitly stated they did not rely on the information provided in their investigation or charging decisions.
The email chain indicates ongoing legal proceedings related to Epstein's death investigation and attempts by individuals to gain leniency through cooperation.
